title: Dewormer ivermectin as cancer cure? RFK Jr.'s NIH funds "absurd" study.
desc: There's no reason to think ivermectin cures cancer, but RFK Jr's NIH is on it anyway.

title: Operations halted as EALA MPs go three months without pay
desc: Operations at the East Africa Legislative Assembly, EALA, have been disrupted after member states delayed fund remittances, leaving MPs and staff unpaid for the past three months.

title: Mohamed Salah's Saudi transfer saga begins! Liverpool star in talks with Pro League giants over summer move after shift in stance
desc: Mohamed Salah is reportedly in talks with Saudi Pro League giants Al-Ittihad over a potential move in the summer transfer window. The Egyptian has been a long-term target for Saudi Arabian clubs since the Public Investment Fund first started pouring cash into the country's top league and Salah, who has endured a tetchy and difficult season at Liverpool, is wanted as their next marquee signing this year.

title: Sharge’s new power bank can charge two laptops while putting on a light show
desc: Sharge’s new Shargeek 300 power bank can charge up to four devices simultaneously including a pair of power-hungry laptops.

title: Malinowski concedes to Mejia in House Democratic primary in New Jersey : NPR
desc: With the race still too close to call, former congressman Tom Malinowski conceded to challenger Analilia Mejia in a Democratic primary to replace the seat vacated by New Jersey Gov. Mikie Sherrill.

title: Canadian pairs team Stellato-Dudek, Deschamps will compete at Olympics
desc: Canadian pairs team Deanna Stellato-Dudek and Maxime Deschamps will get their chance at Olympic glory after all. The pair will leave Montreal on Wednesday and arrive in Milan on Thursday after Stellato-Dudek was cleared to compete, Skate Canada announced Tuesday.

title: Scheme to compensate Stardust survivors 'disappointing'
desc: A solicitor acting for survivors of the Stardust fire has called a scheme to compensate them a "very disappointing development".

title: Earth's core may contain as much as 45 oceans' worth of hydrogen, scientists find
desc: Picture all of Earth's oceans, which cover about 70% of the planet and are mostly made of hydrogen. Now multiply that by nine. That may be the amount of hydrogen in Earth's core.

title: 'Victim of unspeakable cruelty and deliberate evil': Coroner's findings on Malachi Subecz death
desc: Everything possible went wrong for 5-year-old in the last six months of his life, as he was tortured, and no one noticed.

title: Ashley Farquharson wins bronze for second-ever U.S. Olympic medal in women’s luge
desc: Farquharson sealed the bronze medal with a strong fourth run, earning just the seventh U.S. Olympic luge medal ever, men or women.
